{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Call Centre Agent",
  "description": "ConSol Limited, is the leading provider of Contact/Call Center services and Customer Management Solutions in Nigeria.With over 13 years of experience working with leading brands across 17 industries in Nigeria, our consulting service is focused on helping you effectively acquire, satisfy, engage and retain your customers through your contact centre operations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Call Centre Agent

Job Location:&nbsp;Ilupeju, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a proactive and articulate Customer Service Representative to join our team.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for providing exceptional customer support, resolving inquiries, and ensuring a positive customer experience.


Key Responsibilities


	Respond to customer inquiries via phone calls, emails, social media, and in-person interactions.
	Maintain a professional, positive, and customer-focused attitude at all times.
	Provide accurate information about products, services, and policies.
	Resolve customer complaints efficiently and escalate issues when necessary.
	Maintain records of customer interactions, feedback, and transactions.
	Follow up on customer requests to ensure timely resolution.
	Support the sales and operations team with customer-related tasks.
	Ensure compliance with company procedures and service standards.


Requirements


	OND / HND / B.Sc in any discipline.
	0&ndash;3years of experience in customer service or related role.
	NYSC members can apply.
	Must reside within Mushin, Oshodi, Ilupeju, or Gbagada axis for proximity to work.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Clear diction and eloquence are essential.
	Ability to multitask, stay organized, and work under pressure.
	Basic computer proficiency (Microsoft Office &amp; internet usage).
	Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
	Preferably, candidates residing within Mushin, Oshodi, Ilupeju or Gbagada axis, Lagos


Preferred Skills:


	Good telephone etiquette.
	Ability to handle difficult customers with patience.
	Willingness to learn and adapt in a fast-paced environment.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;apply@consollimited.com&nbsp;using &quot;Customer Service&ndash; Your Name&quot; as the subject of the email.",
  "datePosted": "2025-12-08",
  "validThrough": "2026-02-16",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "ConSol Limited"
    
  },

    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "191515"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Call Centre Agent Job at ConSol Limited




        
    

        
        ConSol Limited, is the leading provider of Contact/Call Center services and Customer Management Solutions in Nigeria.With over 13 years of experience working with leading brands across 17 industries in Nigeria, our consulting service is focused on helping you effectively acquire, satisfy, engage and retain your customers through your contact centre operations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Call Centre Agent

Job Location: Ilupeju, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a proactive and articulate Customer Service Representative to join our team.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for providing exceptional customer support, resolving inquiries, and ensuring a positive customer experience.


Key Responsibilities


	Respond to customer inquiries via phone calls, emails, social media, and in-person interactions.
	Maintain a professional, positive, and customer-focused attitude at all times.
	Provide accurate information about products, services, and policies.
	Resolve customer complaints efficiently and escalate issues when necessary.
	Maintain records of customer interactions, feedback, and transactions.
	Follow up on customer requests to ensure timely resolution.
	Support the sales and operations team with customer-related tasks.
	Ensure compliance with company procedures and service standards.


Requirements


	OND / HND / B.Sc in any discipline.
	0–3years of experience in customer service or related role.
	NYSC members can apply.
	Must reside within Mushin, Oshodi, Ilupeju, or Gbagada axis for proximity to work.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Clear diction and eloquence are essential.
	Ability to multitask, stay organized, and work under pressure.
	Basic computer proficiency (Microsoft Office & internet usage).
	Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
	Preferably, candidates residing within Mushin, Oshodi, Ilupeju or Gbagada axis, Lagos


Preferred Skills:


	Good telephone etiquette.
	Ability to handle difficult customers with patience.
	Willingness to learn and adapt in a fast-paced environment.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: apply@consollimited.com using "Customer Service– Your Name" as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Digital Marketer",
  "description": "Mshel Homes Limited is a real estate development and marketing company incorporated in 2018 with a unique vision to be the leading real estate company in Nigeria, with an outstanding reputation for honesty, integrity and impeccable customer service.

At Mshel Homes Limited our mission is to create a lifetime relationship with our clientele by deliverying property solutions through innovative and technological driven processes that caters to your real estate needs whilst adhering to the highest standards, systems and performance goals necessary to achieving your dreams.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Digital Marketer&nbsp;

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)
Job type: Full-time

Job Summary


	Mshel Homes Limited is seeking a results-driven and innovative Digital Marketer to join our dynamic team.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for planning, creating, executing, and optimizing digital marketing campaigns across various online platform
	The role focuses on increasing brand visibility, driving engagement, generating leads, and improving overall digital performance through data-driven strategies.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and execute digital marketing strategies to drive brand awareness, generate leads, and boost property sales.
	Plan and manage multi-channel digital marketing campaigns, including social media, email marketing, content marketing, and online advertising.
	Create and optimize targeted online ads through Google Ads, Facebook Ads, Instagram, and other relevant platforms.
	Monitor, analyze, and report on campaign performance, providing insights and recommendations for improvement.
	Develop engaging and relevant content, including graphics, videos, blog posts, and social media updates, aligned with Mshel Homes Limited&rsquo;s brand and marketing goals.
	Manage and grow the company&rsquo;s social media presence by creating impactful posts and engaging with followers.
	Collaborate with the graphics and content creation teams to produce high-quality marketing materials.
	Optimize the company&rsquo;s website for search engines (SEO) to increase organic traffic.
	Manage and update website content, ensuring a user-friendly experience and accurate property listings.
	Utilize analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics) to track website performance and implement data-driven enhancements.
	Implement effective lead generation strategies through digital channels.
	Utilize Customer Relationship Management (CRM) tools to track leads, manage follow-ups, and enhance customer engagement.
	Develop and execute email marketing campaigns, including newsletters and promotional offers.


Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Marketing, Digital Media, Communications, or a related field.
	Proven experience as a Digital Marketer, preferably within the real estate sector.
	Proficient in digital marketing tools and platforms, including Google Ads, Meta Business Suite, MailChimp, SEO tools, and content management systems (CMS).
	Strong understanding of SEO, SEM, PPC, and social media marketing strategies.
	Excellent content creation skills, including copywriting, video editing, and graphic design basics.
	Data-driven mindset with the ability to analyze metrics and derive actionable insights.


Skills:


	Strong creativity and innovative thinking.
	Excellent communication and presentation skills.
	High level of attention to detail and organizational skills.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a collaborative team.
	Up-to-date with the latest digital marketing trends and technologies.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary and performance-based incentives.
	Opportunities for professional growth and development.
	A collaborative and innovative work environment.
	The chance to make a meaningful impact within the real estate industry.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;mshelrecruitment@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

  "validThrough": "2026-01-09",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Mshel Homes Limited"
    
  },

Digital Marketer Job at Mshel Homes Limited




        
    

        
        Mshel Homes Limited is a real estate development and marketing company incorporated in 2018 with a unique vision to be the leading real estate company in Nigeria, with an outstanding reputation for honesty, integrity and impeccable customer service.

At Mshel Homes Limited our mission is to create a lifetime relationship with our clientele by deliverying property solutions through innovative and technological driven processes that caters to your real estate needs whilst adhering to the highest standards, systems and performance goals necessary to achieving your dreams.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Digital Marketer 
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Job type: Full-time

Job Summary


	Mshel Homes Limited is seeking a results-driven and innovative Digital Marketer to join our dynamic team.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for planning, creating, executing, and optimizing digital marketing campaigns across various online platform
	The role focuses on increasing brand visibility, driving engagement, generating leads, and improving overall digital performance through data-driven strategies.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and execute digital marketing strategies to drive brand awareness, generate leads, and boost property sales.
	Plan and manage multi-channel digital marketing campaigns, including social media, email marketing, content marketing, and online advertising.
	Create and optimize targeted online ads through Google Ads, Facebook Ads, Instagram, and other relevant platforms.
	Monitor, analyze, and report on campaign performance, providing insights and recommendations for improvement.
	Develop engaging and relevant content, including graphics, videos, blog posts, and social media updates, aligned with Mshel Homes Limited’s brand and marketing goals.
	Manage and grow the company’s social media presence by creating impactful posts and engaging with followers.
	Collaborate with the graphics and content creation teams to produce high-quality marketing materials.
	Optimize the company’s website for search engines (SEO) to increase organic traffic.
	Manage and update website content, ensuring a user-friendly experience and accurate property listings.
	Utilize analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics) to track website performance and implement data-driven enhancements.
	Implement effective lead generation strategies through digital channels.
	Utilize Customer Relationship Management (CRM) tools to track leads, manage follow-ups, and enhance customer engagement.
	Develop and execute email marketing campaigns, including newsletters and promotional offers.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Digital Media, Communications, or a related field.
	Proven experience as a Digital Marketer, preferably within the real estate sector.
	Proficient in digital marketing tools and platforms, including Google Ads, Meta Business Suite, MailChimp, SEO tools, and content management systems (CMS).
	Strong understanding of SEO, SEM, PPC, and social media marketing strategies.
	Excellent content creation skills, including copywriting, video editing, and graphic design basics.
	Data-driven mindset with the ability to analyze metrics and derive actionable insights.


Skills:


	Strong creativity and innovative thinking.
	Excellent communication and presentation skills.
	High level of attention to detail and organizational skills.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a collaborative team.
	Up-to-date with the latest digital marketing trends and technologies.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary and performance-based incentives.
	Opportunities for professional growth and development.
	A collaborative and innovative work environment.
	The chance to make a meaningful impact within the real estate industry.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: mshelrecruitment@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Quality Control Officer",
  "description": "natnudO has been revolutionizing the poultry industry for over 10 years. We are committed to meeting and exceeding the Nigerian market&rsquo;s demand for high-quality animal protein.

We provide a full range of high-quality, tasty animal protein products to satisfy our growing market. Our products offer great value for money while strictly following global best practices for food processing.

We maintain a high level of organizational excellence in all aspects of our business, from production to distribution, until the products get to our esteemed consumers. Every product is carefully processed and packaged according to the highest global health standards. All our products are NAFDAC and SON certified. natnudO Foods is growing to provide a diverse range of protein products for all our customers.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quality Control Officer

Job Locations:&nbsp;Kaduna South - Kaduna and Akinyele - Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Purpose


	The Quality Control Officer ensures that all poultry products and processes at natnudO Foods Abbatior, Kaduna, comply with established food safety, quality, and regulatory standards.
	The role is responsible for monitoring production, conducting tests, enforcing compliance with SOPs, and maintaining product integrity from chicken productionto finished goods.


Key Responsibilities
Quality Assurance &amp; Compliance:


	Monitor and ensure compliance with national and international food safety regulations (NAFDAC, SON, HACCP, ISO 22000, GMP).
	Enforce Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) across all production stages.
	Conduct routine inspections of production lines, cold rooms, and packaging units to ensure compliance with hygiene and quality standards.


Testing &amp; Monitoring:


	Perform microbial and chemical tests on raw materials, water, and finished chicken products.
	Monitor critical control points (CCPs) and document corrective actions when deviations occur.
	Verify that products meet weight, temperature, and packaging requirements.


Documentation &amp; Reporting:


	Maintain accurate and up-to-date quality records, inspection logs, and deviation reports.
	Prepare daily, weekly, and monthly quality reports for management review.
	Track and report non-conformances, recommending improvements where necessary.


Process Improvement &amp; Training:


	Collaborate with production and maintenance teams to improve quality processes.
	Support the implementation of continuous improvement initiatives in quality systems.
	Train staff on Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP), hygiene standards, and food safety awareness.


Customer &amp; Regulatory Audits:


	Assist in preparing for external audits (regulatory bodies, customers, and certifications).
	Provide necessary documentation and act as a liaison during inspections.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Compliance rate with HACCP and food safety standards.
	Number of non-conformance cases reported and resolved.
	Accuracy and timeliness of quality reports.
	Customer complaints related to product quality.
	Staff adherence to GMP and hygiene practices.


Qualifications &amp; Experience


	B.Sc / HND in Food Science, Microbiology, Biochemistry, Animal Science, or related field.
	4&ndash;6 years&rsquo; experience in Quality Control / Quality Assurance in a food processing, poultry, or FMCG environment.
	Knowledge of HACCP, ISO 22000, GMP, and regulatory compliance in food production.
	Familiarity with microbial testing, laboratory procedures, and food safety monitoring tools.


Skills &amp; Competencies:


	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Attention to detail and ability to spot deviations quickly.
	Good communication and report-writing skills.
	Ability to work under pressure and in a cold-room environment.
	Proficiency in MS Office and quality management systems.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their&nbsp;application to:&nbsp;vacancies@afshltd.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Quality Control Officer Job at natnudO




        
    

        
        natnudO has been revolutionizing the poultry industry for over 10 years. We are committed to meeting and exceeding the Nigerian market’s demand for high-quality animal protein.

We provide a full range of high-quality, tasty animal protein products to satisfy our growing market. Our products offer great value for money while strictly following global best practices for food processing.
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



We maintain a high level of organizational excellence in all aspects of our business, from production to distribution, until the products get to our esteemed consumers. Every product is carefully processed and packaged according to the highest global health standards. All our products are NAFDAC and SON certified. natnudO Foods is growing to provide a diverse range of protein products for all our customers.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quality Control Officer

Job Locations: Kaduna South - Kaduna and Akinyele - Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Purpose


	The Quality Control Officer ensures that all poultry products and processes at natnudO Foods Abbatior, Kaduna, comply with established food safety, quality, and regulatory standards.
	The role is responsible for monitoring production, conducting tests, enforcing compliance with SOPs, and maintaining product integrity from chicken productionto finished goods.


Key Responsibilities
Quality Assurance & Compliance:


	Monitor and ensure compliance with national and international food safety regulations (NAFDAC, SON, HACCP, ISO 22000, GMP).
	Enforce Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) across all production stages.
	Conduct routine inspections of production lines, cold rooms, and packaging units to ensure compliance with hygiene and quality standards.


Testing & Monitoring:


	Perform microbial and chemical tests on raw materials, water, and finished chicken products.
	Monitor critical control points (CCPs) and document corrective actions when deviations occur.
	Verify that products meet weight, temperature, and packaging requirements.


Documentation & Reporting:


	Maintain accurate and up-to-date quality records, inspection logs, and deviation reports.
	Prepare daily, weekly, and monthly quality reports for management review.
	Track and report non-conformances, recommending improvements where necessary.


Process Improvement & Training:


	Collaborate with production and maintenance teams to improve quality processes.
	Support the implementation of continuous improvement initiatives in quality systems.
	Train staff on Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP), hygiene standards, and food safety awareness.


Customer & Regulatory Audits:


	Assist in preparing for external audits (regulatory bodies, customers, and certifications).
	Provide necessary documentation and act as a liaison during inspections.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Compliance rate with HACCP and food safety standards.
	Number of non-conformance cases reported and resolved.
	Accuracy and timeliness of quality reports.
	Customer complaints related to product quality.
	Staff adherence to GMP and hygiene practices.


Qualifications & Experience


	B.Sc / HND in Food Science, Microbiology, Biochemistry, Animal Science, or related field.
	4–6 years’ experience in Quality Control / Quality Assurance in a food processing, poultry, or FMCG environment.
	Knowledge of HACCP, ISO 22000, GMP, and regulatory compliance in food production.
	Familiarity with microbial testing, laboratory procedures, and food safety monitoring tools.


Skills & Competencies:


	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Attention to detail and ability to spot deviations quickly.
	Good communication and report-writing skills.
	Ability to work under pressure and in a cold-room environment.
	Proficiency in MS Office and quality management systems.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their application to: vacancies@afshltd.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Admin / Cashier",
  "description": "At Uleval Technology, we help businesses from healthcare, Oil and Gas, transportation, real estate, communication, and other industries seize new opportunities, overcome business challenges.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Admin / Cashier

Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary&nbsp;


	We are recruiting for a 5 star hotel An Admin/Cashier who can handleboth general office tasks (answering phones, filing, correspondence, scheduling) and financial duties (processing payments, managing cash drawers, balancing accounts, issuing receipts) with a strong focus on accuracy, customer service, and maintaining records, requiring skills in communication, organization, and basic accounting/POS systems.


Key Responsibilities:


	Customer Service:Greet visitors, answer phones, address inquiries, handle complaints, and provide information.
	Cash Handling:Process payments (cash, card, check), issue receipts, provide change, balance cash drawers, and prepare bank deposits.
	Administrative Support:Manage mail, schedule appointments, maintain records, file documents, and handle general office correspondence.
	Financial Record Keeping:Accurately record transactions, manage petty cash, prepare reports, and assist with accounts receivable/payable.
	Office Operations:Maintain a clean workspace, restock supplies, and assist with inventory.


Key Skills &amp; Qualifications


	High school diploma or equivalent.
	Experience with POS systems, cash registers, and Microsoft Office.
	Strong math, organizational, and multitasking skills.
	Excellent verbal communication and interpersonal skills.
	Attention to detail and high level of integrity.


Sample Duties Breakdown:


	Admin Focus:Sorting mail, typing, data entry, managing calendars, assisting with event planning.
	Cashier Focus:Operating the till, scanning items, handling returns, tracking sales, ensuring till accuracy.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;jobs@uleval.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

  },

Admin / Cashier Job at Uleval Technology




        
    

        
        At Uleval Technology, we help businesses from healthcare, Oil and Gas, transportation, real estate, communication, and other industries seize new opportunities, overcome business challenges.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Admin / Cashier

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary 
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are recruiting for a 5 star hotel An Admin/Cashier who can handleboth general office tasks (answering phones, filing, correspondence, scheduling) and financial duties (processing payments, managing cash drawers, balancing accounts, issuing receipts) with a strong focus on accuracy, customer service, and maintaining records, requiring skills in communication, organization, and basic accounting/POS systems.


Key Responsibilities:


	Customer Service:Greet visitors, answer phones, address inquiries, handle complaints, and provide information.
	Cash Handling:Process payments (cash, card, check), issue receipts, provide change, balance cash drawers, and prepare bank deposits.
	Administrative Support:Manage mail, schedule appointments, maintain records, file documents, and handle general office correspondence.
	Financial Record Keeping:Accurately record transactions, manage petty cash, prepare reports, and assist with accounts receivable/payable.
	Office Operations:Maintain a clean workspace, restock supplies, and assist with inventory.


Key Skills & Qualifications


	High school diploma or equivalent.
	Experience with POS systems, cash registers, and Microsoft Office.
	Strong math, organizational, and multitasking skills.
	Excellent verbal communication and interpersonal skills.
	Attention to detail and high level of integrity.


Sample Duties Breakdown:


	Admin Focus:Sorting mail, typing, data entry, managing calendars, assisting with event planning.
	Cashier Focus:Operating the till, scanning items, handling returns, tracking sales, ensuring till accuracy.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: jobs@uleval.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply
